title: Nothing to compile error on Windows
body:
Running `npx hh compile --force` still results in "Nothing to compile".
Multiple people reporting the same issue. Here is repro repo:
https://github.com/ihorbond/hardhat-test

This issue is also being [tracked on Linear](https://linear.app/nomic-foundation/issue/HH-659/nothing-to-compile-error-[nomicfoundationhardhat2712]).

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: ee06ca10-693a-4d2e-86ff-574b58b985ab
Got the same issue.
Even roll back to previous successful version ("hardhat": "^2.8.4"), It still doesn't work~

Same error on the latest version - reverting back to 2.9.3 doesn't fix it. 
It fails even on the sample project.
Luckily I've ran it successfully before on an older version so I could do npm list --depth=0 to see the installed packages

Only difference was hardhat@2.9.3 and @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers@2.0.5 instead of hardhat@2.9.5 and @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers@2.0.6

Installing those same versions in the new project still couldn't resolve the problem.
Running npm list --depth=0 in both the working and non-working project returned the same output and yet it still didn't work....

 - So I just copied the entire node_modules folder from the project that was working and it works....
一样的问题，但是使用以前的工程，就可以compile

> Same error on the latest version - reverting back to 2.9.3 doesn't fix it. It fails even on the sample project. Luckily I've ran it successfully before on an older version so I could do npm list --depth=0 to see the installed packages
> 
> Only difference was hardhat@2.9.3 and @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers@2.0.5 instead of hardhat@2.9.5 and @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers@2.0.6
> 
> Installing those same versions in the new project still couldn't resolve the problem. Running npm list --depth=0 in both the working and non-working project returned the same output and yet it still didn't work....
> 
>     * So I just copied the entire node_modules folder from the project that was working and it works....

Brilliant, I took the caret off the hardhat-ethers version and my build is working again!  Thank you, big brain friend!

    "@nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers": "2.0.5"
Did anyone else find another solution? I don't see copying the node folder as a long term solution

I'm trying to figure it out too. So far have tried:
Setting the dependencies to hardhat@2.9.3 and @nomiclabs/hardhat-ethers@2.0.5 in package.json
Deleting cache/ and node_modules/
npm install
npx hardhat compile

Still get the nothing to compile error.

Somehow hardhat isn't seeing the /contracts/ folder. I'm wondering if this is due to some accessibility permissions.
If you noticed when you compile it's not saving in the cache the folder info, also it doesn't create the /artifacts/ folder.

I tried rolling back to v 2.9.3 (which is working fine on my mac) but still having the same issue, so I'm also wondering if this issue is only in Windows.

Yeah you are right. A quick fix is to run commands from WSL (Windows subsystem for Linux). It runs fine from there.

Thanks for your help @TheyCallMeCheng

I finally found it.
glob@7.2.2 <- This is problem

I haven't looked for it exactly from what point, but it's version 7.2.0 in the package at the point where that package works well, and version 7.2.2 in the "nothing to compile" version.

- Type the "npm intstall glob@7.2.0" into an empty project and copy /node_modules/glob
- copy /node_modules/glob to YOUR_HARDHAT_PROJECT/node_modules/hardhat/node_modules/glob

It works.

> I finally found it. glob@7.2.2 <- This is problem
> 
> I haven't looked for it exactly from what point, but it's version 7.2.0 in the package at the point where that package works well, and version 7.2.2 in the "nothing to compile" version.
> 
> * Type the "npm intstall glob@7.2.0" into an empty project and copy /node_modules/glob
> * copy /node_modules/glob to YOUR_HARDHAT_PROJECT/node_modules/hardhat/node_modules/glob
> 
> It works.

Seems to work fine if you just do `npm install glob@7.2.0` in a current hardhat project, thank you

Yes this fixes it for me also. Thanks

> 

Thank you. This fixes it for me too.

> 

I just compiled with VS Code solidity extension for now, it places result into bin folder. It does seem like a Windows issue cause it does work on Linux

> npm install glob@7.2.0
Thank you , That is working .

Yeah these solved my issue THANK YOU!

> 

This mostly will install glob under your project `node_modules ` but you need the correct glob under hardhat node_modules like 

`projectpath/node_modules/hardhat/node_modules/glob` is what need to be replaced . 

At least that was what worked for me.
Issue solved asof today, thank you glob trotter...

YOUR_HARDHAT_PROJECT/node_modules/hardhat/node_modules/glob 
I don't have  node_modules/glob inside hardhat folder.

please tell me how did you downloaded hardhat

I downloaded it by following the instructions from 

https://hardhat.org/getting-started/

> YOUR_HARDHAT_PROJECT/node_modules/hardhat/node_modules/glob I don't have node_modules/glob inside hardhat folder.
> 
> please tell me how did you downloaded hardhat
> 
> I downloaded it by following the instructions from
> 
> https://hardhat.org/getting-started/

No that will not placed like that you can find glob folder in YOUR_HARDHAT_PROJECT/node_modules folder.
Replaced in it but doesn't work

> Replaced in it but doesn't work

Delete the node_modules folder and run `npm install` command.

> > Replaced in it but doesn't work
> 
> Delete the node_modules folder and run `npm install` command.

Can you specify the command
